thought_traces.reasoning: Scouting for competitors near 123 Main St
Classifying products into BCG Matrix quadrants based on market share and growth
observations: Using sales data for market dynamics

bcg: Discovery Phase: Since USPs are currently undefined, perform a 'Signature Audit' on high-margin items. Items with the highest repeat purchase rate should be retroactively designated as your 'Stars' and foundational USPs.

Menu Engineering: Without stated values (like health-conscious or indulgence), treat 'Question Marks' as experimental slots to test different cuisines or price points to see what the local market naturally gravitates toward.
pricing: Market-Responsive Strategy: In the absence of specific goals, implement 'Dynamic Testing.' Start with mid-market pricing to gather a broad data set, then pivot toward 'Premium' or 'Value' based on which segment shows the highest customer lifetime value (CLV).
Elasticity Benchmarking: Use promotional 'Power Hours' to identify the price sensitivity of your neighborhood, helping to define the Target Audience by their spending habits.
positioning: The 'Blank Canvas' Approach: Position the restaurant as a fresh, community-led space. Use the lack of history as a strength, marketing the venue as 'The Neighborhood’s Newest Tradition' where the customers help write the story.

Reliability Focus: Until specific brand values are identified, lead with 'Universal Quality'—positioning the brand around high standards of service and cleanliness to appeal to the widest possible demographic.

personalized_campaigns.title: The 'Help Us Build It' Series
personalized_campaigns.copy: We’re new, we’re fresh, and we want to be your favorite. Tell us what your dream neighborhood spot looks like, and watch us bring it to life.
personalized_campaigns.why: Directly addresses the 'N/A' context by turning the lack of history/values into an interactive brand-building exercise.

personalized_campaigns.title: Founders’ Choice Secret Menu
personalized_campaigns.copy: We’re testing three new secret recipes this week. Come in, try them, and vote for the one that earns a permanent spot on our menu.
personalized_campaigns.why: Uses customer feedback to identify USPs and Target Audience preferences in real-time.

goals_addressed: Identity Formation: The primary goal is to transition from 'N/A' to a defined brand profile. This strategy uses the first 3 months of operations as a 'Live Pilot' to gather the data needed for a full brand launch.
challenges_tackled: Brand Anonymity: By inviting the neighborhood to 'shape the restaurant,' we overcome the challenge of having no established history or USP, creating an immediate emotional investment from locals.
